title: Spoiler-free Shoutcasting
body:
Dear Riot Shoutcasters,

Can you please try not to reveal the outcome of other games during a game? I'm in the Air Force and my job has me out of the house for 4 days at a time and I can't stream the games live and watch all the games in exact order. I have to watch them on YouTube very slowly since the Internet where I work is extremely slow. It was a little disheartening to watch the TSM and TIP playoff series and learn that C9 had won the other series before I had a chance to watch it.

I'm not trying to offend the shoutcasters in any way whatsoever, I would just like to request that if you can try to keep other games' outcomes disclosed until the anylyst desk. This would be much appreciated.

                                                                                        Sincerely,
 A huge LCS fan.

replies.body:
Yeah I suppose you get into the moment and forget but it's such a let down. Half the fun of watching a BO5 series is not knowing who is going to make it in the end.

I got to see the UOL vs SK gaming series spoiler-free and I was on the edge of my seat the whole series, especially the last game. I would have been devasted if I knew the outcome of that series ahead of time.

This is understandable, there are so many ways for games to be spoiled. Social Media, Reddit, LoL Forums, the added mis-step from a caster is just another in the pile of things looking to spoil the fun.
It should be that way anyways. They specifically promote the VODs as Spoiler Free. Just seems like some casters get excitable and forget about that.
